tit.e: Izu no kuni no miyatsuko (regional governer in ancient Japan)
tit.cmt: kunimiyatsuko--> Izu no Kuni no miyatsuko (government post) government postだけではなく、そもそもgovernmentらしきものが成立する前のことでもありますし誤解が多いのではないかと思い、regional governor in ancient Japan（古代日本の地域の統括者、としてみました。
tit.e: Izu no kuni no miyatsuko (regional governer in ancient Japan)

sen.j: 伊豆国造（いずのくにみやつこ・いずこくぞう）は伊豆国を支配した国造。
sen.e: Izunokunimiyatsuko was kuninomiyatsuko ruled Izu Province.
Izu no kuni no miyatsuko (or Izu kokuzou) was a Kuni no miyatsuko that governed Izu Province in ancient Japan.
sen.cmt: kunimiyatsuko--> Izu no Kuni no miyatsuko
sen.e: Izu no kuni no miyatsuko (or Izu kokuzou) was a Kuni no miyatsuko that governed Izu Province in ancient Japan.
Wakatakenomikoto written as 若多祁命.
Wakatake no mikoto (若多祁命).
Wakatake no mikoto (若多祁命).
His pseudonym was Wakatakenomikoto written as 若建命.
He is also known as 若建命, with the same sound.
He is also known as 若建命, with the same sound.

sen.j: 日本武尊の子の稚武王のことか？『国造本紀』によると神功朝に伊豆国造に任じられたとある。
sen.e: It is supposed to indicate Wakatakenomikoto 稚武王, a son of Yamatotakerunomikoto; but according to "Kuninomiyatsuko hongi", Wakatakenomikoto was appointed Izunokunimiyatsuko during the reign of Empress Jingu (also known as Shinko.)
sen.cmt: 「神功朝」は「神功皇后の統治下に」として訳しました。
sen.e: It has been said he could have been Wakatake no mikoto (稚武王), a son of Yamatotakeru no mikoto, while he was appointed as Izuno Kuni no miyatsuko during the reign of Empress Jingu (also known as Shinko), according to "Kuni no miyatsuko hongi".

It has been said he could have been Wakatake no mikoto (稚武王), a son of Yamatotakeru no mikoto, while he was appointed as Izuno Kuni no miyatsuko during the reign of Empress Jingu (also known as Shinko), according to "Kuni no miyatsuko hongi".

sen.j: 現在の静岡県伊豆半島。
sen.e: The present Izu Peninsula, Shizuoka Prefecture.
The present Izu Peninsula, Shizuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: 日下部益人 ...... 奈良時代の地方豪族。
sen.e: KUSAKABE no Masuhito: Regional powerful clan who was active during the Nara period.
KUSAKABE no Masuhito: A regional powerful clan who was active during the Nara period.
sen.cmt: Regional powerful clan --> A regional powerful clan
sen.e: KUSAKABE no Masuhito: A regional powerful clan who was active during the Nara period.

sen.j: 伊豆国造伊豆直の姓を賜る。
sen.e: He was conferred on Kabane 'Izunokunimiyatsuko Izu no Atai'.
He was given a Kabane 'Izu no kuni no miyatsuko Izu no Atai".
sen.cmt: kunimiyatsuko--> Izu no Kuni no miyatsuko
sen.e: He was given a Kabane 'Izu no kuni no miyatsuko Izu no Atai".

sen.j: 伊豆乎美奈 ...... 奈良時代の官人。
sen.e: Izu Omina: A government official during the Nara period.
